timeline.message: merged and adding more implementation in operator

timeline.bodyText:
use assertj - will make this look like
import static org.assertj.core.api.Assertions.*;

 assertThat(namespace)
            .as("make sure namespace is not empty or null")
            .isNotEqualTo("")
            .isNotNull();

which is a lot clearer
timeline.author: markxnelson

replies.bodyText: looking for something similar to isNotNullOrEmpty() as it takes care of multiple white spaces..
replies.author: vanajamukkara

replies.bodyText: We have Guava as a dependency in other modules.  You could add it here and use: assertFalse(Strings.isNullOrEmpty(text));
replies.author: rjeberhard

replies.bodyText:
added assertj core dependency and doing ..
    assertThat(namespace)
        .as("make sure namespace is not empty or null")
        .isNotNull()
        .isNotEmpty();
replies.author: vanajamukkara

timeline.bodyText: why delete the namespace? seems a bit extreme
timeline.author: markxnelson

replies.bodyText: what if the namespace already exists? just proceed with it?
replies.author: vanajamukkara

replies.bodyText: yeah - the method is meant to install an operator --- if doing so deleted the target namespace, that would be unexpected and surprising behavior.  we should not do that
replies.author: markxnelson

replies.bodyText: ok, will modify the code accordingly
replies.author: vanajamukkara

timeline.bodyText: i'm not sure about this being a string like this - i liked it better the way you had it before, where is was clear it was a list of things, this is just a string that has some kind of special meaning that i don't understand
timeline.author: markxnelson
markxnelson

timeline.bodyText: again, this is surprising/unexpected.  the method is installOperator - i would not expect that to create a namespace. if you try to deploy something into a non-existent namespace in k8s, it will give an error.  that is what i would expect this to do too. we should try to stick to the standard/predictable/expected behavior
timeline.author: markxnelson

replies.bodyText: ok ..I will create the namespace, service account in the test class ..
replies.author: vanajamukkara

timeline.author: markxnelson

timeline.bodyText: wow, that's a bit awkward.  is there an assertJ assertion we can use instead of this one, that makes the code a bit nicer?
timeline.author: markxnelson

timeline.bodyText: put it in the log, not SOP
timeline.author: markxnelson
